it.unipr.ce.dsg.deus.core
Class Node

java.lang.Object
  it.unipr.ce.dsg.deus.core.SimulationObject
      it.unipr.ce.dsg.deus.core.Node
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.lang.Cloneable, java.lang.Comparable<Node>
Direct Known Subclasses:
BasicNode, Peer
public abstract class Node
extends SimulationObject
implements java.lang.Comparable<Node>, java.lang.Cloneable

The Node class represents the "entity" inside the simulation. Nodes are simulation object that are being created, deleted and used to store information.

Each node is identified by the configuration id, a set of properties and a set of resources.

Author:
Matteo Agosti (agosti@ce.unipr.it), Michele Amoretti (michele.amoretti@unipr.it)

Constructor Detail

Node

public Node(java.lang.String id,
            java.util.Properties params,
            java.util.ArrayList<Resource> resources)
     throws InvalidParamsException
Class constructor that builds the node with its minimal set of properties. Each implementing class should call the super constructor and immediately after invoke the initialize method to check that the node parameters are correct.

Parameters:
id - the identifier of the node as specified in the configuration file.
params - the properties that will be handled by the node.
resources - the set of resources associated to the node.
Throws:
InvalidParamsException - if the given parameter are wrong.
Method Detail

initialize

public abstract void initialize()
                         throws InvalidParamsException
Provides the initialization of the node according to the given parameters. This method should also perform a check on the parameters values.

Throws:
InvalidParamsException - if the parameters passed to the node are wrong.

Performs the standard Object.equals comparison by using the node id as the criteria.

public Node createInstance(java.lang.String id)
